Systems:

OPERATOR

REALSPACE EXTRUSION BEAM

At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

TRACE DRIVE

The Operator teleports when they make their standard move.

STEP

The Operator teleports to a free space within line of sight and range 50.

SELF-ERASURE

When the Operator’s mech is destroyed, it immediately self-immolates in a wave of superheated plasma. All characters adjacent to the Operator when this takes place must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/6/8} Energy damage. On a success, they take half damage. This mech is then removed from the battlefield – it is utterly annihilated.

TELEFRAG

The Operator teleports into a space occupied by another character within line of sight and range 15. The target must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/8/12} AP Energy damage and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and aren’t Jammed. Succeed or fail, the Operator takes 1d6 AP Energy damage and is placed into a free space next to the target.

TORRENT

No description given.

ULTRA

BEST OF THE BEST

The Ultra can’t take the Elite or Grunt templates.

SHOCK AND AWE

The Ultra takes two separate turns each round. They regain spent reactions each time they take a turn.
If the Ultra is facing five or more hostile characters when combat begins, the Ultra takes a third turn each round.

DEADLY

The Ultra deals +1d6 damage on critical hits.

JUGGERNAUT

At the start of the Ultra’s turn, they clear one condition. At the end of their turn, they repair one destroyed weapon or system.

REINFORCED

The Ultra gains +3 Structure and +3 Stress.

LEGENDARY

The Ultra rolls all structure damage and overheating checks twice and chooses either result.

ADVANCED KIT

The Ultra chooses 1–2 additional optional systems from their class.

REFLEX

The Ultra can Overwatch unlimited times per round.

ULTRA SYSTEMS AND TRAITS

The Ultra chooses 1–3 options from the Ultra Systems and Traits list.

SLIVERSHIELDING

This system replaces Resilient. The Ultra becomes permanently Invisible.

REPULSION FIELD

When hostile characters start their turn adjacent to the Ultra or become adjacent to the Ultra for the first time on their turn, they take {2/4/6} Energy damage + 2 heat and must succeed on a Systems save or become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

EXOTIC

XENOTECH

Scan doesn’t reveal any information about Exotic Systems.

HARDENED TARGET

The Exotic gains +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +1 Difficulty.

EXOTIC SYSTEMS

The Exotic chooses up to two options from the Exotic Systems and Traits list.
